channel.title: Security Company?
channel.description: Well i was walking by the dollar store, and i noticed a security advertisement on there door, stating Piece of mind. Is that spelled right? I always thought it was peace of mind? [url=http://www.matrixsecurity.ca/]http://www.matrixsecurity.ca/[/url] so i did a little research, and its spelled that way on the website to. If this is spelled the wrong way, would you want to go with them knowing that there so incompetent that they cant spell check? I mean, Its for an advertisement, wouldn't you want to look good?

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Just a thought, but maybe there suppose to stop the “piece of mind” getting seperated from your head when your shop gets raided?

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Didn’t seem deliberate nor humorous.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

“A pun (also known as paronomasia) is a figure of speech which consists of a deliberate confusion of similar words or phrases for rhetorical effect, whether humorous or serious.” seemed like a pun to me…

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

How is that a pun? Judging by their website and unprofessional layout, I’m guessing they are completely wrong. The idiom is “peace of mind.”

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

To be completely honest, I would go to them. From their website it looks like their a wholesaler, and maybe an installer. They don’t make the shit, don’t worry about them being incompetent. But, I would have already gotten AT&T if I wanted a security system. It’s the best, simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Yeah, companies try to sound intelligent by using puns.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

Piece of Mind = Somewhat intelligent

Peace of Mind = lolwut? Possibly a hippy?

To answer your question, no, it’s been spelled correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Security Company?
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Companies who spell wrong fail. So no, I wouldn’t… And thing about it, it’s a dollar store, what other security can they afford?

EDIT: So they spelled right, go with them.

Read full topic
